title: Flux GA release spec and long term support pledge
body:
This PR introduces the release specifications for the Flux GA distribution.

The release documentation tries to answer questions like:
- How we release and version Flux, its CLI, controllers, Go packages and APIs
- How often are we going to release new Flux versions post-GA
- For which Flux versions we offer support and for how long
- Which Kubernetes versions are supported by a Flux release

Preview:
- [Flux distribution](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/blob/docs-release-spec/docs/release/flux.md)
- [Flux APIs and controllers](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/blob/docs-release-spec/docs/release/controllers.md)
- [Flux shared libraries](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/blob/docs-release-spec/docs/release/packages.md)
- [Flux release procedure](https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/blob/docs-release-spec/docs/release/procedure.md)

title: [RFC] Gating Flux reconciliation
body:
Add proposal for introducing a gating mechanism to Flux that would offer a way for cluster admins and other teams involved in the release process to manually approve the rollout of changes onto clusters.

In addition, Flux could offer a way to define maintenance time windows and other time-based gates, to allow a better control of applications and infrastructure changes to critical system.

**Note** that this proposal is WIP, we need to cover more use-cases from https://github.com/fluxcd/flux2/discussions/870

title: [RFC] Define Flux tenancy models
body:
The main goal of this RFC is to define the Kubernetes tenancy models supported by Flux.


This PR attempts to document the status quo, and should provide clarity of what multi-tenancy capabilities Flux has. It also functions as a base for rewriting the loose proposal in #582 into well scoped RFCs.

title: Add bootstrap option to set a prefix for the commit messages
body:
Flux bootstrap already has an option to set a suffix for the commit messages. This change also adds a prefix. It's handy in environments where commit messages have to start with some ticket number for example.

I'm not a go developer: I basically copied the code of the 'commitMessageAppendix' option.

Signed-off-by: Dries Verachtert <dries.verachtert@dries.eu>
